statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Holy Cross 51, Rhode Island 50
article.story: SOUTH KINGSTOWN, R.I. (AP) -- Kevin Hamilton scored 12 points and Torey Thomas chipped in with 11 as Holy Cross (7-4) held off a late Rhode Island (2-9) charge for a 51-50 win Sunday. Holy Cross missed five foul shots and had a costly turnover in the final minutes of the game, but Rhode Island failed to capture the lead. Neither team scored a field goal in the final 4:02. Terrence Mack led Rhode Island with a career-high 16 points, but went just two-of-four from the foul line in the final two minutes. Mack had a chance to tie the game with 1:10 to play, but made just one-of-two from the foul line, pulling Rhode Island to 51-50. Holy Cross used an 8-0 run in the second half to build a 46-36 lead, the largest of the game for either team. Rhode Island answered with its own 8-0 run to get back into it, with Mack scoring three points and Parfait Bitee hitting a 3-pointer. The first half was a back-and-forth affair with four ties and nine lead changes. The largest lead of the half was a 23-19 advantage for Holy Cross after Hamilton made a jumper with 4:13 to play. Mack slammed home a dunk with 22 seconds left in the first to tie the score, 23-23. Thomas hit a 3-pointer just before the buzzer to give Holy Cross a 26-23 lead at the half.
